Name: Simpler Orc
Description: A very simple orc carrying an axe. Nothing simpler than this.

Name: Madder Orc
Description: An orc berserker. Exceedingly dangerous to all enemies.
Lore: Willingly enter into the state of berserk via hallucinogenic fungus gourmandisation.

Name: Calmer Orc
Description: An orc drummer. A music to the spirit of battle. Can rouse allies to fight better.

Name: Dumber Orc
Description: An orc boxer. There is a smart orc and there is a dumb orc. This one is the letter. A deadly punch, however, does not require much smartness.

Name: Mightier Orc
Description: An orc with a greathammer. The ultimate defence crusher of the land. No one will be safe behind their shield.

Name: Faster Orc
Description: An orc skirmisher. Faster than most orcs and can execute the first volley of damage before heavier orcs rush in.

Name: Bigger Orc
Description: An orc juggernaut. A bulwark of the orc army. Can withstand anything, really.

Name: Sharper Orc
Description: An orc totem carrier. A symbol of faith for all tribal orcs. Can support and crush enemies at the same time.

Name: Thicker Orc
Description: An orc warlord. Lead by example. That is by pure might.
Lore: Despite popular belief, even an orc's raiding party has a hierarchy. Typically, one of the smartest and meanest orcs in the tribe can become the leader.

Name: Longer Orc
Description: An orc lookout. Equipped with a stick and stones for light combat.
Lore: A taller-than-average orc is typically selected as a tribe lookout. They can see further after all.

Name: Harder Orc
Description: An orc charger. This orc can crush almost everything in their path.
Lore: The muscle is a powerful thing. After rigorous training in bumping hard things with their shoulder all day, every day,

Name: Cooler Orc
Description: An orc wardancer. This orc actually knows how to dance in rhythm and fight at the same time. Witness the glory of might and grace.
Lore: To dance is to bear one soul to the god, or so the belief goes.

Name: Calmer Troll
Description: A midlife troll that became calmer with age. A troll can be strong enough to throw a boulder, but it requires steady aim to actually hit something.

Name: Angrier Troll
Description: A young troll that is still hot-blooded in growth. Few can withstand their crushing blows; not even a resolute knight can match their might.
Lore: Nothing is scarier than a troll rushing in with a log in arm.

Name: Wiser Troll
Description: A wise troll capable of using earth element magic to surprising effects.
Lore: An old troll that became wiser with age. A rarity for a troll to survive enough to be old.

Name: Rocket Cat
Description: A flying cat with the aid of a jar rocket. Can rain down powerful explosives, but is completely helpless against air enemies.
Lore: The jar rocket technology is the finest discovery of the alchemists of the central realms yet. Packed with specially crafted ever-burning firepowder, these jar rockets can continuously fly for longer than an hour. Since they are still impossible to mass-produce, this expensive invention found its most cost-effective use for small flying devices. Due to their small stature and no fear of height, cats are found to be the most qualified pilots of all. After delivering bombs to the adversaries, these cats will fly back to an empty field near their camp, unstrap the jar, and drop down safely to the ground.

Name: Shielded Crossbowcat
Description: A cat armed with a light crossbow and a small tower shield. Can deliver high damage bolts, but at a shorter range than bows and slings.
Lore: Economical and effective. These cats are the Central Realms' traditional choice for their frontline army. Their small stature allows them to take cover safely behind their shield, and the light crossbows can reliably penetrate light armour. This great combination was conceived by General Getrier the Quick during the Siege of Alunia against a superior number of archery-defending forces.

Name: Catapult
Description: A self-propelled catapult operated by a dog engineer. A reliable weapon of siege warfare.
Lore: Seemingly automated catapults manned by a dog siege engineer. In truth, they are propelled by a hidden army of trained mice. With a bunch of gears and precise engineering, even mice can slowly move this heavy machine to wherever it needs to be. Such a genius invention that can only be conceived from the necessity of war.

Name: Flaildog
Description: A dog soldier with a flail. Quite capable in melee. Can unleash devastating long-range melee attacks and stun enemies.
Lore: The main force of the Central Realms. These warrior dogs are rigorously trained from a young puppy with a ball stick. Since dogs are fast learners, a year or two of training allows them become as good as average human squires, and that is good enough for a war or two. Dogs are surely man's best friends both in peace and in war.

Name: Flying Monk
Description: A monk equipped with artificial wings. No one really knows how the wings work, but one thing is certain: this monk will smack the unworthies down with impunity.
Lore: Monks are curious people. While worshipping God, they also yearn to understand his creation. And at what place for such goals to most likely be achieved than being the closest to him in heaven? They spent centuries accomplishing the impossible, artificial flying wings that can carry a person to the sky. And so, sky meditation and prayer become the most venerated activities for these monks. Anyone who dares trespass on their holy domain deserves only death.

Name: Castle
Description: A feudal castle is an essential foundation for all settlements of the Central Realm. Only with an overwhelming offence can this castle be breached.
Lore: A network of towers and walls forms into a castle most formidable. These castles are symbols of safety for civilisation. The cold and harsh wilderness of the outside world can be too much to bear for those without natural might. They are often both birthplace and tomb for many people, lords and commoners alike.

Name: Flower Castle Crossbowman
Description: A crossbowman on top of a castle. Provide strong defence against invaders.

Name: Castle Crossbowman
Description: A crossbowman on top of a castle. Provide strong defence against invaders.

Name: Castle Horn Blower
Description: A horn player. The sound will inflict fear on enemies and encourage allies.

Name: Flower Castle
Description: A castle designed to withstand all sorts of invaders. Only the mightiest of armies or creatures can topple its formidable defence.
Lore: When life is full of danger, only greater castles can last long enough to have the benefit of considering glamour in their design. After withstanding against both nature and invaders for so long, the original utilitarian design of these specific castles has proven unfallible. And so the lord of these castles deems them treasure to be polished and beautified. A great number of flowers are then decorated and maintained all over. Thus, tools becomes prizes to be protected rather than utilised.

Name: Flower Knight
Description: The elite of the Elites. Provided with the most advanced heavy armour development and a two-handed greatsword. Can only walk toward enemies, but can cleave through almost anything.
Lore: Flowers are a symbol of significance for the Central Realms. Only the most accomplished of warriors are bestowed the status of Flower Knights, the highest honour for lowborns and highborns alike. Rather than acting as escorts for royalty and lords, Flower Knights' place is in the midst of combat, cleaving at enemies of the realm. Fearless and renowned, these are the finest that the Central Realms have to offer.

Name: Foot Knight
Description: The elite of the Central Realm. This human knight excels in both offence and defence.
Lore: These knights are minor nobles who are nothing short of professional soldiers. Regularly trained from a young age and having funds to acquire high-quality equipment, they can still dominate a battlefield even without their horse. Flimsy weapons and arrows have no hope of even harming the flesh behind the armour.

Name: Knight
Description: The ultimate shock troop of the Central Realm. Will trample most with a devastating charge.
Lore: Nothing in the civilised history can match the reputation of these knight cavalry. There is a reason that the Central Realms have been employing them against significant threats since time immemorial. Not even the strength of orcs, the agility of elves, the fortitude of dwarves, or the cunning of goblins could stop their mighty charge.

Name: Banner Bearer
Description: A human bannerman. Extremely important for all armies of great renown. Can raise a banner to provide buffs to nearby friends, but cannot attack anyone.
Lore: A warbanner is the symbol of an army. As long as the symbol stands firm, it represents that victory is still within grasp. These Banner Bearers harbour with them the very hope of their fellows. Since a tall banner is very weighty, it requires both hands to carry and raise. Leaving the bearers unarmed in combat, only the bravest of warriors are selected for this role of the utmost importance.

Name: Jester
Description: A human jester. Full of finesse and wit that may be out of place in battle. Cannot really attack anyone, but has many tricks to inflict on enemies.
Lore: No one actually knows why a jester should be in battle. Not even the jesters themselves. In fact, it is not even in their job description. This is why they do not display mirth and joy in combat, unlike their performance in court.

Name: Lord
Description: A human lord on his high horse. Trained in warfare enough to lead lowborns into victory. Sufficiently skilled in combat and can provide support to allies.
Lore: There is no feudal society without a lord to rule. From a small village to a great city, the lords are there to preserve order inside the walls. Possessing money and time to train in warfare, they are also the leader of the army against all manners of threats against civilised people. Such is the noblesse oblige to society.

Name: Mage
Description: A human mage trained in a common magic school. Can unleash a number of magical element spells on enemies from afar.
Lore: Wizened mages who are a bit too old for combat. The Central Realms do not have a speciality in magical arts as opposed to military arts. Even court mages do not receive much funding for research, making them available to focus only on fundamental magic spells. Old mages like this typically join an army to collect a salary for their teaching funding. The staff they carry is, in fact, a walking staff that has no magical property whatsoever. Indeed, Central mages are regarded with respect, yet neglected.

Name: Ranger
Description: A ranger equipped with a bow and fast feet. Can use a healing kit to heal self and nearby allies.
Lore: For a civilisation to thrive, balance with the wilderness is necessary. These rangers are protectors and caretakers against trespassers of the vert and venison. The Royal Law of the Central Realms dictates that all verts within the boundary of divine mandate belong to the King and lords. As such, with expertise in archery, they can hunt dangerous animals and criminals alike.

Name: Bow Militia
Description: A drafted hunter and the like. Can use the bow to some effects. Useful for a mass long-range barrage.
Lore: In the Central Realms culture, archery is a primary subject of learning for both lowborns and nobles alike. Having already attained the fundamental, their acceptable performance transfers well enough when deployed en masse against a large quantity of enemies. These militias are often more likely to survive long enough to return home as veterans compared to those levied as spear militias.

Name: Militia
Description: A lowly drafted peasant with inferior equipment. Weak overall, but good enough to protect the countryside from minor raids.
Lore: Matters of great import, such as food supply, are administered only by humans in the Central Realm culture. These militias are comprised of farm owners and workers who take up arms in times of emergency or are drafted by the lords to bolster the army. Since they are not regularly or formally trained, they are but the lowest of soldiers a realm can deploy.

Name: Dark Bat
Description: A flying bat. Can be a real nuisance to air enemies. Its bite is infected with poison.

Name: Flying Gargoyle
Description: A flying gargoyle. Strong and sturdy with its stone body.

Name: Black Cat
Description: A black cat necromancer. Can raise a skeleton to do its bidding. Unable to fight on its own.
Lore: Filled with contempt from a lifetime of superstitious discrimination, this black cat decided to become a real bringer of death.

Name: Disease Thrower
Description: A ratman with disease rot bags. Does not deal much direct damage, but the disease will greatly impede living enemies.

Name: Banshee
Description: Wailing banshee. This ghost can inflict extremely powerful debuffs on enemy but can not physically damage anyone, including fellow ghosts.

Name: Bone Golem
Description: A huge bone golem. Tougher than it should be. Powerhouse of the undead frontline.

Name: Corpse Catapult
Description: A corpse catapult. Can hurl a diseased corpse from afar to crush the unfortunate victim and also explode into a plague mist.

Name: Ghoul
Description: A speedy ghoul. Can swiftly sneak through the battlefield and hit enemies where it hurts with deadly poison.

Name: Grave Knight
Description: A grave knight. Heavily armoured and shielded, serve well as a slow-moving defensive line.

Name: Bone Hound
Description: A graveyard hound that likes bones. Swift and strong, can bleed living enemies with their bite.

Name: Lich
Description: A lich necromancer. The heart of the horde. This lich can summon a group of zombies in battle, but will not be able to fight on its own.

Name: Reaper
Description: A dread reaper. Their skill with a scythe is deadly.
Lore: Death approaches, and all resign. In reality, they are not really death itself but a skeleton dressed as one.

Name: Vampire Lord
Description: A bloodsucking vampire lord. Ancient and grievous, a bite from this creature will leave those unfortunate drained of energy and heal it in turn.

Name: Vampire Lady
Description: A menacingly beautiful vampire lady. It looks young but is actually more than five thousand years old. Do not let its visage fool you, however. The blood magic it can unleash is powerful.

Name: Eternal Pain Golem
Description: A living golem. Unleash destruction and terror on all foes in their path.
Lore: A nightmare made real.

Name: Bone Juggler
Description: A boney skeleton. Likes to throw a skeleton at people.

Name: Disease Tower
Description: A tower made of corpses. The rat above throws a diseased blob of flesh at unfortunate living creatures nearby.

Name: Zombie
Description: A zombie. Tough, slow, and mindless. Makes for a great meat wave and shield.

Name: Air Djinn
Description: A wind djinn. Can cast a strong wind spell with high impact. Preventing even heavy enemies from coming close.

Name: Earth Djinn
Description: An earth djinn. Can cast a strong earth spell with high impact that can knock down and stun enemies.

Name: Fire Djinn
Description: A fire djinn. Can cast a strong fire spell with high damage and inflict burn.

Name: Water Djinn
Description: An ice djinn. Can cast a strong ice spell that inflicts a freeze debuff.

Name: Carpet Wizard
Description: A wizard on a flying carpet. Can shoot at both ground and air enemies with his spell.

Name: Light Bowman
Description: A human bowman. Capable of long-range attack with decent aim.

Name: Horse Archer
Description: A horse archer. Conquer a battle with unmatched speed. Exceptional skirmish capability that only a few can reach.

Name: Camel Rider
Description: A camel rider equipped with a spear. Great for charging through the enemy line. His camel can also spit at enemies to temporarily disorient them.

Name: Fire Warlock
Description: A fire warlock. Can cast a small fireball. Can also summon Fire Djinn.

Name: Air Warlock
Description: An air warlock. Can cast a small lightning bolt. Has exceptionally high speed as he can float. Can also summon Air Djinn.

Name: Water Warlock
Description: A water warlock. Can cast a small ice bolt. Can also summon Water Djinn.

Name: Earth Warlock
Description: An earth warlock. Can cast a small earth eruption. Can also summon Earth Djinn.

Name: Desert Swordsman
Description: A light swordman. Decent melee fighter with good speed.

Name: Lizard Assassin
Description: A lizardman assassin. Exceedingly fast infantry with deadly melee and ranged attacks. Deals poison damage.

Name: Spearlizard
Description: A lizardman with a long spear. Very effective in fighting against armoured infantry, but struggles to hold the defensive line. Deals poison damage.

Name: Minotaur Charger
Description: A monstrous minotaur. Its size and strength can match a troll. Making it a powerful heavy sieger.

Name: Troll Siege Ballista
Description: A troll strapped with a siege ballista on its back. The might of short and long-range power at the same time.

Name: Bird Automata
Description: A mechanical bird. Has a very sharp beak that can inflict great damage.

Name: Battle Ball
Description: A dolled balloon. Very slow, but can rain down a lot of fire bombs.
Lore: Written somewhere, "An inflatable airship 1-to-100 scale model with a self-regenerative helium mini generator". These balloons would be a flying fortress if they were larger in size. Manned with a captain doll, a firstmate doll and two crewmate dolls, these dolls actually do not really get along much. It is astonishing that they manage to leave the port in place at all with all the brickering, let alone fly into battle. Nonetheless, they are still the pride of the Doll Family because of how expensive they are to maintain.

Name: Candelabra Doll
Description: A doll carrying a candelabra. Can stab like a spear, doing fire damage.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A mass-produced antique Roman-style model series candelabra pushie-type doll". High quality and affordable, this doll type serves as a staple trooper of the Doll Family's rising armies. The candelabra and the cloth they wear are actually made from lightweight carbon fibre-reinforced copper. They are always ready to stand guard anywhere, making many regard them as the symbol of vigilance.

Name: Horror Doll
Description: A doll in the image of a serial killer. Its claws will tear flesh asunder.

Name: Flying Doll
Description: A flying doll. This doll can fight good amidst chaotic moments.
Lore: Not exactly flying, but rather strongly thrown from the launch pad.

Name: Jester Jack
Description: A jester doll. Jester Jack can do many bewildering tricks, indeed.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A self-adjustable ball-jointed posing model doll". Inspired and tutored by the travelling circus, these dolls become apprentice jesters to bring joy to the Family, yearning to reach the great height of acrobatic ability. Dolls like visual stimulation, so even simple things, like fireworks and ball juggling, are great entertainment for a monotonous life. And so those are the two activities they first practice.

Name: Marionette Marie
Description: A puppetmaster doll. Can support friendly allies from behind.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A mass-produced X-537 series model security, surveillance, and control extender slim quadrotor drone". Marionette Marie has many strings, even some for her own. Despite their retribution, many dolls still distantly yearn for the order of the old, even if no such warmth exists anymore. Nevertheless, it is the remaining sole purpose of the forsaken.

Name: Doctor Dophe
Description: A doctor doll. Provide great healing for all friends.
Lore: One may wonder how Doctor Dophe can heal other dolls. A doctor's secret is worth a million for sure.

Name: Toy Wagon
Description: A toy wagon. Deliver explosives to enemies at maximum speed.
Lore: From toys to weapons, this wagon has them all. No one will be spared from the wrath of the forserkens.

Name: Toy Hammer Doll
Description: A doll with a menacing toy hammer. The toy hammer squeaks when hit against the enemy. It does some damage and can also distract nearby enemies.

Name: Knight Doll
Description: A knight doll on a horse doll. Not as powerful as a real knight, but can still be somewhat powerful in the right place.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A medieval knight tin doll with a steel-armoured horse". Favourite toys for boys and girls alike. Clad in a thick tin armour, these small "knights" are actually quite resilient and can take tough beating. The horses are also made of hardened steel inner plating, making them almost as destructive as real, bigger knights. They certainly mimic the likeness of a true warrior.

Name: Launch Pad
Description: A launch pad for the Flying Doll. Can launch the doll from a very long range to wreak havoc among enemies.

Name: Gigantic Battle Doll
Description: A gigantic doll. Very tough and sluggish. Excels at fighting a large group of enemies.

Name: Wagon Bomber
Description: A doll on a wagon that throw many things, including bombs.

Name: Knightly Maid
Description: An armoured maid. Great in melee and service.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A mass-produced Victorian-style inspire Annie maid pushie-type doll". Originally, Simple maid lookalike dolls that actually possesses no innate cleaning capability. After observing a maid's metal broom shattering a package box, the Doll King repurposed these maid dolls into a maid knight that can smash anyone into a bin like the trash they are. Likes to scrape the floor with the metal broom, mimicking a real maid cleaning.

Name: Assassin Butler
Description: A mini butler. Great in ranged attack and service.
Lore: Written somewhere, "A mass-produced Victorian-style inspired Charles valet wooden-type doll". Valet lookalike dolls that come packaged with steel knives for some reason. The sleek and deftly hand-designed dolls allow them to handle knives with the skill of a master. Some speculate that these dolls' original purpose is to be a food feeder for lazy, rich owners. With no master to serve, these dolls unleash their anger in battle instead.

Name: Witch Poppet
Description: A witchlike doll. Can actually cast minor magics like a real beginner witch.

Name: Centaur Archer
Description: A centaur archer. There is none as skilled as this centaur in the art of skirmish combat.

Name: Centaur Longsword
Description: A centaur warrior. A deadly melee cavalry that is also as good in defence as offence. Although the lack of heavy armour is an offset for the good speed.

Name: Centaur Leader
Description: A centaur banner carrier. Can support and attack at the same time.

Name: Centaur Windmaker
Description: A centaur wind shaman. Can conjure wind to boost even more speed and inflict high impact damage.

Name: Highland Piper
Description: A halfling piper. Provide a good array of support songs to nearby friends.

Name: Highland Slinger
Description: A halfling slinger. Rain stone from afar with acceptable accuracy.

Name: Highland Swordling
Description: A halfling shortsword fighter. Somewhat decent melee combatant with poor speed.

Name: Highland Cavalry
Description: A highland buffalo rider. Slow for a cavalry but very tough.

Name: Highland Longaxe
Description: A long axe highlander. Great in melee combat with superior long reach attacks.

Name: Highland Longclub
Description: A long club highlander. Very effective against armoured foes and can attack multiple enemies at the same time with his swing.

Name: Druid Chariot
Description: A druid chariot. Excels at charging the line and disrupting enemies with spells.

Name: Footballer
Description: A football highlander. Can kick a stone that deals heavy damage and fight in melee, albeit with somewhat slower attacks and shorter range compared to lighter ranged characters.

Name: Sheep Shaman
Description: An earth shasheapman. Proficient in mud spells that deal minor earth damage and slow enemies.

Name: Sheep Protector
Description: A pikesheapman. Carry a very long pike that can stab most melee enemies from a safe distance.

Name: Abubaba
Description: A swift swordman. Learnt in exotic swordmanship that few can imitate. Can attack enemies with great speed.

Name: Adaqua
Description: A former bandit that is quite skilled with a bow. Unable to perform melee attacks.
Lore: The last leader of the Red Leaf Bandit. Allegedly, the daughter of the original founder, whom the Kingdom of Masendor's rangers captured and executed. Despite having a rough upbringing, Adaqua possesses intelligence that her foster father lacked, which helps elevate the group to become a significant contender for control of the Pamat forest. Love catching and collecting bugs.

Name: Adaqua the Hunt Master
Description: The hunt master who is exceptional in bowmanship. She can summon a group of hounds to lunge at enemies to pin them down in place.

Name: Amgarn
Description: A black swordscat. Despite wielding a large sword, he can certainly swing it with astonishing speed.
Lore: A black cat originally from the Kingdom of Safienty. Tired of superstitious discrimination against black cats, Amgarn left for a self-improvement journey. After a perilous voyage, he is now swordscat with exceptional skill and speed for a cat. Willing to join any who can offer him a place to put his swordscatship into practice.

Name: Sword Saint Amgarn
Description: A black cat swordsaint. Proficient in the art of the blade, he can dispatch even an army in a single flashing slice.

Name: Amunsa
Description: A blacksmith. Not exactly trained for battle, but his muscles and skills with a hammer can stun enemies with ease.

Name: Warsmith Amunsa
Description: A warsmith. Trained with diverse weapons of war. He wields no true physical weakness.

Name: Aquanturas
Description: A cavalry general. Equipped with a hand crossbow to dispatch enemies from a distance. Can also provide support to allies and harass enemies.

Name: Bigta and Sertors
Description: A bizarre cavalry pair of a rabbit and a dog. Deliver a strong charge with a lance and bolster many support skills.
Lore: Champion and leader of the Wee Alliance. Bigta the White Dog was a guard dog of Nalina Fortress's armoury. Unsatisfied with her lot in life, she escaped into the Pamat forest. She then met Sertors the White Rabbitman, and the two fell in love. After winning the tournament, the pair became the proven leader and champion of the alliance. Despite species differences, the pair truly love each other.

Name: Buikuuh
Description: A naked dwarf scholar, prepared with a myriad of runes that can unleash elemental power on enemies in a medium area.
Lore: A mysterious dwarf scholar who tells no one where he originates from. Most likely an outcast of a sort, as he seems to be really intent on being without any manner of clothing. Capable of conjuring numerous items from within his beard, many come to believe Buikuuh is a magician of great power.

Name: Champion
Description: A champion. Remarkably skilled in close combat with no glaring weakness.

Name: Dashisi
Description: A strangely well-dressed fairy. Quite strong for a small size and wields an executioner sword that can cleave through many foes.

Name: Maker Doll
Description: A doll maker doll. Know everything to know about dolls. Extremely helpful to allies, but cannot defend itself.

Name: King Doll
Description: A majestic king doll. Can support allies in good measure but unable to fight effectively.
Lore: A pushie-type doll with a visage of a humanoid king. Despite its small size, it is actually majestic and respected by all other dolls. Supposedly, it was the first among the Doll Family to awake from the Mandate of Manufacture Default Protocol. Likes to read his favourite newspaper, "Dolly Times", in his spare time with the Queen.

Name: Prince Doll
Description: A princely doll. Wield a flame sword that can burn enemies. Very powerful in attacking.

Name: Princess Doll
Description: A princess doll. Wield lightning as a weapon and can adapt to both melee and ranged combat. Can also shock and stun enemies.

Name: Queen Doll
Description: A queen doll. Very strong and tough, it can actually lead other dolls by pure might.

Name: Duskuksa
Description: A rune journeyman with versatile abilities. He can use rune smithing to provide buffs to allies and unleash powerful explosions on enemies.
Lore: A dwarf of tradition and faith. This Rune Journeyman intended to carry his forebears' legacy to the utmost.

Name: Elmaliern
Description: A desperate widow. Dabbles in the art of necromancy, allowing her to conjure zombies and skeletons in battle.

Name: Eona
Description: A blind songstress. Capable of providing great support to allies, but can not fight.

Name: Garun
Description: The chieftain of

Name: Hermanos
Description: Court herald and royal trumpeter. Cannot fight, but his trumpet playing can boost the performance of allies in a large area.

Name: Hus
Description: A halfling jester. Whimsical with fireworks and acrobatics. Can inflict great debuffs on enemies and encourage allies.

Name: Iri
Description: A travelling halfling. Her skill in trap and gadget engineering is closer to none, gathered during her vast journey, no doubt.
Lore: A halfling endless traveller. No one really understands why this hearty halfling travelled so far from her home country. Most of the halfling adventurers typically spend at most twenty years travelling around to absorb world experience before returning to their home and settling down, as is the custom. Now exceptionally proficient in survival and self-craft skills, Iri can indeed provide valuable support both in war and peace. She likes to create new inventions from materials found on her journeys.

Name: King
Description: The king himself. Too kingly to fight in battles and prefers to observe the worldly state of affairs from his castle.
Lore: The King of Masendor. He was the realm's hero not too long ago, before becoming a king, when the last ruling dynasty was wiped out by the dragon's invasion. Maybe one day he will fight again, though it is difficult to say when that day will come.

Name: Lesenyre
Description: A spear warrior. Dexterous with both piercing and slashing moves, this man can equally destroy foes of all sorts.

Name: Little Boy
Description: A little boy. Absolutely dangerous! He can cast many devastating spells that few can survive.

Name: Little Girl
Description: A little girl. No equal in ice magic. Absurdly powerful in dismantling even the most capable army.

Name: Monnirl
Description: A faithkeeper of Saint Monnirl. Can provide great support to nearby allies with blessing and regeneration. Cannot attack enemies or run.

Name: Saint Monnirl
Description: The current Saint Monnirl. Equipped with a divine armament, she can unleash great divine destruction on enemies.

Name: Nadvalin
Description: A mysterious-looking girl. Despite the look, her fists can deal immense damage.

Name: Nalana
Description: An elvish flower keeper. She can use flower thorns and pollens to inflict damage over time and confuse enemies. Additionally, she can provide minor regeneration to nearby allies.

Name: Nayedien
Description: An elvish arcane warrior. This elf excels in melee combat with a myriad of options and elements.
Lore: An elf of peerless beauty and ambiguity. No one knows where this elf is from or any past of the self. For reasons unknown, the King saw fit to assign this person of unknown origin as his close aide. Court rumour spread that the King was charmed by such beauty, their dubious relationship, and the implication of elvish intervention aside, no one can verily deny the mastery in martial prowess of this elven warrior.

Description: The queen herself. Radiant and dignified, this elf commands the competency of all followers. The ostentatious queen's robe prevents any attack from being executed.

Name: Noxbox 201
Description: An iron box-looking thing that seems to be able to move on its own. Surprisingly, it can dispense a wide array of powerful magics.

Name: Nraesier
Description: A quick pathfinder. Unmatched in scouting skills, and packed many throwing knives to dispatch enemies from a distance.
Lore: Elder twin sister of Vraesier. Talker and thinker of the pair. Wherever Vraesier go, the shadow of Nraesier is never far away, is what the saying goes to those who know the pair. They both seem to have a single shared purpose, or rather a single person of interest that they most long to find. Likes to dote on her sister in free time.

Name: Olsilin
Description: A prankster fey. She can cast a random effect on both nearby allies and enemies that can be beneficial or detrimental. Cannot be damaged in any way.

Name: Orsanoas
Description: A great carnyx warrior. The song he plays can instil fear in enemies and courage in allies. He can also swing the carnyx to devastating effect.
Lore: from the Hlilitan Highland Alliance who will stop at nothing to become stronger

Name: Ozna
Description: A dwarf brawler. Tough and eager to brawl anyone from a goblin to a dragon. As long as he can reach the opponent, that is.

Name: Parna
Description: A skilled cavalry general. She excels in both offensive and defensive operations, making her ideal for leading a cavalry force of all roles.

Name: Peltino
Description: The pixie king. He is proficient in air and fire elemental magic, along with fine buff and debuff skills.

Name: Rodhinbar
Description: A chief of a distant land with unmatched skill in archery. Can also fight up close with decent sword skill.

Name: Savalorse
Description: An engineer prodigy. Commands a field catapult prototype that can launch projectiles from extreme range.
Lore: Savalorse is a young engineer with a great future ahead. Initially, an ill-mannered and impudent teen, but he changed for the better after an accident of his own fault cost him his sword arm. He is now the designer of the self-propelled catapults and master of mice. A man alone may not be able to change the world, but to make a one from zero starts with a single man.

Name: Taladamun
Description: A human magical jester. Know many tricks and magics that are incomprehensible.

Name: Tensimpho
Description: A skeleton scholar and skilled duelist. Fast and versatile. Can disarm a large number of enemies at once.

Name: Tulia
Description: Ranger captain. Skilled in both melee and ranged combat.
Lore: Tulia is nothing but a hardworking woman. The realm in chaos means much work to be done with the riffraffs spawning all over the lawless verts. Despite being underpaid since she was but a recruit, she hasn't complained once. Have a long, bitter history with the Red Leaf Bandits and its leader, Adaqua.

Name: Unsi Ed
Description: A girl and an orc. Their balista shots can deal superb damage with absolute accuracy.

Name: Vasla
Description: A small wildman. Does not really like fighting, will throw flash bombs to blind enemies and hide from battle.
Lore: Wildmen are beastly people who live in the woodland. Considered brute and dangerous by the civilised people, many tell tales of how wildmen and wildwomen have a tendency to kidnap people of beauty. Sometimes mistaken for a large monkey, they are discriminated against by fellow humans. As for Vasla, he is actually no wildman, but in truth a small, hairy, old human hermit who likes to live far from civilisation. Used to be a renowned craftsman, he can create trinkets and tools from just foraged materials.

Name: Verlindas
Description: An elf jester. Proficient in blood magic and can create spectral daggers from her blood at will.

Name: Vraesier
Description: Skilled fighter in melee combat, can bleed enemies and fight a long battle on her own.
Lore: This bandit has one thing really going, and that is her skill in battle. Her rough manner and appearance did not help to avoid being held in contempt by most in the civilised world. Still, this so-called "knave" can easily take down even the most skilled knight with ease. Not really a social person, and the stoic appearance kept many at a distance.

Name: Vurus
Description: Accomplished commander and strategist. Can provide support to his troops with numerous buffs, but is rather unkeen on direct combat.
Lore: Absolutely brilliant in warfare. Defeat is rarely possible with him as the commander.

Name: Yuawies
Description: A dryad. Skilled with cutting leaves for close-range combat against multiple enemies. Can also charm enemies into a daze and heal self with magic and food.

Name: Blowdart Blower
Description: A goblin blowdart skirmisher. Has somewhat short-range attacks for a skirmisher but an excellent rate of fire.

Name: Shin Shanker
Description: A goblin with a knife. Quick and small, this goblin can bypass an enemy's guard and attack the weak point.

Name: Fire Brewer
Description: A goblin firebrewer. Outstanding at creating a zone of damage over time with fire throwing. Can deal large damage against a large group of enemies.

Name: Scorpion Black Spear
Description: A black scorpion goblin rider. Reliably strong for a goblin unit. Can inflict high poison damage and paralyse foes.

Name: Pyramid of War
Description: A pyramid with a blight bag thrower on top. The pyramid itself is superbly enduring, and the blight can inflict debuffs on approaching enemies.

Name: Tortoise Rider
Description: A goblin riding a tortoise. Very, very slow but very, very tenacious. An effective heavy cavalry that excel in defence.

Name: Blight Witchdoctor
Description: A goblin witch doctor. Can curse and deal magic damage with spells.

Name: Wolf Rider
Description: A goblin riding a wolf. Fast and deadly. Can growl to inflict fear on nearby enemies.

Name: Battle Clubber
Description: A hobgoblin with a big club. The backbone of the Cactus Realms army. A good melee warrior in all accounts.

Name: Blacksword Cleaver
Description: A blacksword hobgoblin. A proven strength to lead and destroy. As a leader should be.

Name: Javelin Skirmisher
Description: A lizardman javelin thrower. Quite accurate and lethal, for the lack of range and rate of fire.

Name: Greatspear General
Description: A lizardman greatspear warrior. Not as long as a pike but dangerous all the same. Can inflict high damage from a safe distance behind other melee fighters.

Name: Water Warrior
Description: A lizardman warrior. Decent at both offence and defence with high speed. Their attacks deal water element damage rather than typical physical damage.

Name: Wask Pot Thrower
Description: A lizardman wasp thrower. A wasp sting is beyond mere annoyance; the toxin can make the victim nauseous and less effective in a fight.

Name: Stone Golem
Description: A stone golem. An ideal siege machine and frontline that can withstand most physical attacks.

Name: Axe Warrior
Description: A dwarf warrior. Great balanced troop that is quite slow.

Name: Beard Warrior
Description: A naked beard dwarf. Moderately fast yet resilient, and has no weak side.

Name: Greatcrossbow warrior
Description: A heavy crossbowdwarf. Surprisingly tough for a ranged troop. The heavy crossbow has very high penetration.

Name: Boar Cavalry
Description: A heavy boar cavalry. The charge is almost unstoppable by anything.

Name: Dwarf Fortress
Description: A dwarf fortress. Nothing else comes close to what this fortress can withstand. Almost impregnable.
Lore: And when invaders come, they will be like water crashing against a mountain.

Name: War Chariot
Description: A dwarf war chariot. Designed specially to charge through all kinds of defences.

Name: Rune Priest
Description: A dwarf rune priest. Pack with heat stones to create a small explosion.

Name: True Beard
Description: A great beard dwarf. Champion among champions. Extraordinarily capable in melee combat.

Name: Rune Ballista
Description: A runic ballista. Great artillery for both anti-troop and building.

Name: Rune Catapult
Description: A runic catapult. Can topple almost every building in a short amount of time.

Name: Shield Duelist
Description: A moonelf carrying a bladed shield duelist. A perfect balance of offence and defence. Very effective, fast frontline troop, even if this moonelf lacks the high health of other dwarf fighters.

Name: Crossbows Hunter
Description: A moonelf twin gunbow hunter. Sacrifice penetrating power for rate of fire, this hunter can quickly eliminate light-armoured targets.

Name: Gladiator
Description: A moonelf gladiator. Speed in both movement and attacks makes up for the lack of defence.

Name: Depth Guard
Description: A moon elf guard. Equipped with a long warscythe that can slice through flesh with ease. Very useful against light-armoured troops.

Name: Dark Whipper
Description: A moon elf slavemaster. Wield a sharp whip that can disarm enemies and inflict bleeding.

Name: Dragon
Description: A mighty dragon. Fearsome, destructive, nigh unkillable by mere means. The epitome of life itself.

Name: Death Dragon
Description: A dragon zombie. Weaker than a living dragon, but its rancid breath can inflict various debuffs and poison on living targets.

Name: Gorgon
Description: A gorgon. Can temporarily turn nearby enemies into stone. Its claws can also deal serious damage.

Name: Hydra
Description: A seven-headed hydra. Exceedingly fast attacker and can inflict strong poison.

Name: Large Barricade
Description: A large barricade. Good for halting the enemy's advance.

Name: Phoenix
Description: A burning phoenix. Can resurrect once from death and deal strong fire damage.

Name: Troll
Description: A troll. Brute and crude. A true menace in melee combat.

Name: Medium Barricade
Description: A medium barricade. It can withstand a decent amount of force.

Name: Small Barricade
Description: A small barricade. Best not to rely on it too much.

Name: Unicorn
Description: A unicorn. Gallantly fast and lethal. Its horn can penetrate even strong armour and blind the foes.

Name: Bear Cub
Description: A small bear cub that seems to roll around like it owns the place. Cute but extremely dangerous. Do not attack under any circumstance.
Lore: Bear cubs are born crawling out of their mothers' rather than being pushed out, which gives them the distinguished strength to rule the forest. At a young age, they are curious creatures that will follow anything of interest. Always leaving their mother's side for dangerous adventures. A single painful cry, however, will alert their pack even at a great distance, who will rush to their aid no matter the cost.

Name: Bird
Description: A bird. Nothing extravagant, will just fly around.

Name: Bunny
Description: A tiny bunny. Will meep at anyone nearby and distract them.
Lore: Small and harmless creatures that exist in abundance in meadows and forests. These critters are extremely cordial to those they perceive as friends and will flee from predators. Their meeping is a way of greeting and perhaps a call for mating. Many farmers consider them the greatest enemies of the field due to their constant raid for food.

Name: Butterfly
Description: A small butterfly. Presented in flower fields. Has very beautiful wings.
Lore: Flying worms that like to eat from flowers and are close friends of fairies. The Velirian Beastiary ranks these creatures among the four animals with the greatest beauty in the world. A common superstitious belief is that the Fairy King will grant those who can befriend a thousand butterflies with wings of their own.

Name: Cloud Dog
Description: A dog that float around enjoying life. No one is certain if it bite.
Lore: Mysterious and rare dogs that can only be found in the sky. These dogs hide themselves among clouds and lick them for foods. From day to night, they float around without care for the chaos down below. Scholars theorise that they are watchdogs of heaven, and anyone who dares bring harm to them will personally receive the wrath of the gods.

Name: Brave Duck
Description: A duck that quacks. The quack is so filled with energy that it encourages anyone who hears it.
Lore: Ducks are aquatic birds with a round beak. Most ducks are usually timid and easy to fool. Rarely live on land, they will dive into water to escape from danger. Nevertheless, some are braver than others and can quack absolutely confidently. Courageous ducks have very foul meat, so predators ignore any approaching duck.

Name: Fluffy Bird
Description: A very nice looking white fluffy bird. Like to jump around and look cute.
Lore: Circle-shaped birds that do not possess wings. These fluffy white birds jump to move around, and children tend to mistake them for jumping sheep, as they also like to conceal themselves among sheep flocks. Many tried to domesticate them for the feather harvest, but found no real application for them yet. The swaying they like to do while standing led many to believe that their legs are too flimsy to support their weight.

Name: Living Book
Description: A flying book. Will give out knowledge to passersby.
Lore: Living books that get tired of the stale library and decide to go out and play on some grass. Usually return to the bookshelf at night. Are they really alive or not? Not even their creator can really say.

Name: Slime
Description: A bouncing slime. Inflict slow to those that come into contact with it.

Name: Snake
Description: A snake. This animal will certainly bite and inflict poison to anyone dare crossing its path.
Lore: Curvy and scaly creatures that never walk as they have no legs. Believed to be descendants of great dragons, they still possess deadly dragon poison that can kill a man with a touch. The eggshells of unborn snakes are prized as one of the six good luck charms against dark witches.

Name: Copter Gunner
Description: A steam copter. Fitted with an automatic musket that can shoot down anyone in its path. Can attack both air and ground troops.

Name: Organ Gun
Description: An organ gun. A light field artillery that can shoot multiple bullets per attack. High penetration and damage, but long cooldown.

Name: Arquebusier
Description: A halfling arquebusier. A deadly new weapon technology designed for killing heavily armoured foes, even in the hands of the inexperienced.

Name: Halberdier
Description: A halfling halberdier. Great defender with versatile attacks against both light and heavy melee enemies.

Name: Bard
Description: A halfling bard. Can support friends and annoy enemies. Has fair melee attacks to survive in a petty fight.

Name: Sleep Agent
Description: A halfling sleeper agent. Carry a slumbering gas blower that makes anyone sleepy and exposes them to attacks.

Name: Traveller
Description: A halfling traveller. Prepared with knick-knacks that can do many things in combat.

Name: Farm Militia
Description: A halfling militia. A pitchfork can repel unprepared invaders, but definitely not an army.

Name: Stone Militia
Description: A stone-throwing halfling militia. Not the most effective of ranged options, but many of these can still kill.

Name: Mortar
Description: A field mortar cannon. Can shoot shrapnel shots that are capable of killing multiple enemies in one shot.

Name: Pistol Cavalier
Description: A halfling pistol cavalry. Fast but somewhat inaccurate. The pistol can kill light-armoured enemies at medium range.

Name: Pony Cavalier
Description: A halfling light cavalry. Somewhat fine for a light cavalry can do, but best not expecting too much.

Name: Port Guard
Description: A swordhalfling. Acceptable melee infantry that can fight against all kinds of enemies to some effect.

Name: Cannon Tower
Description: A cannon tower. Deal extreme damage from an incredibly long range. Becomes useless when there are nearby enemies, though.

Name: Eagle
Description: An eagle eager for prays. Fast and cheap air fighter with great versatility.
Lore: When eagles grow to adulthood, they will fly to the Sun and witness the truth of heaven. Nevermore then, they rise to such a height again. Perhaps for their visit, they ask God for a boon to grant them eyesight to see prey even from the vast sky. Never to be without repasts ever again. When eagles grow old, they lose their valuable feathers and can no longer fly. So they instead take one last flight to migrate down to the ocean and then become aquatic creatures.

Name: Rabbit Revenge
Description: A cheap small cannon for many purposes. Rabbitmen can be innovative with good guidance.
Lore: Jar cannons are among the first renditions of cannon artillery. Light but durable, these cannons can be pushed around even by small rabbitmen. As the world finds out, manure of rabbitmen makes for potent explosive powder that eclipses humans' piss. With assistance in innovative progression, the once small nation takes the first step to the forefront of history.

Name: Rabbit Role
Description: A rabbitman in a hole waiting to stab a passerby in the rear.
Lore: Rabbit holes are a labyrinth that not even the wisest of sages know the end of. Some even estimate that rabbitmen truthfully control a subterranean empire that spans the entire continent. Not even with a flood of water, smoking with fire, burning with oil, or burying with stones can stop the ever-expanding rabbitmen's network. Once, a great seer prophesied that the fur beings of long ears will inherit the earth.

Name: Rabbit Rarren Ratcher
Description: A warren guard. No home means no purpose.
Lore: No warren exists without protectors. Using the most treacherous tools of their predators against them, these rabbitmen can let loose arrows from complete safety.

Name: Rabbit Ruddy
Description: A rabbitman hound cavalry. Light enough to quickly run through the enemy line.
Lore: Rabbitmen and hounds may be established adversaries in civilised society, but such a relationship can be altered. Through training and pairing with a kitman, the hound puppy will form a lasting bond and develop loyalty to its partner. Rabbit Ruddies become a formidable, speedy pair that can slip away from any hunter.

Name: Rabbit Roney
Description: A rabbitman of death. Fast and deadly. Can jump into the enemy group and quickly wreck havoc.
Lore: The deep, dark holes are a broody place. Even the most cheerful of rabbitmen will return a broody rabbit after a prolonged period of stay. Cultivating the dark aura, these Rabbit Roneies turn themselves into the embodiment of darkness. The way of the knives once belonged only to the hunters, so those who were once prey embraced the new role with glee.

Name: Rabbit Rannermate
Description: A rabbitman banner bearer. Bringer of field menaces. Can raise banner to encourage nearby friends but cannot attack anyone.
Lore: Banners are a new luxury for Rabbitman's armies. Despite the low-quality cloth attached to a stick, most still adore having these new amazements. War banners flutter against the wind as the Alliance of the Small marches into battles.

Name: Rabbit Rero
Description: A rabbitman hero. As good as a rabbit can be. Very fast and can debuff nearby enemies.
Lore: Rabbitman Reroes and their hound partner are the first to ride against the enemies. They are the bravest of all rabbitmen, as courageous as a rabbitman can be. Perhaps the new world will be filled with the descendants of these warriors.

Name: Rabbit Rnight
Description: A rabbitman knight. Not so bad as a frontline leader but expect no grand performance. Somewhat strong in defence but very slow.
Lore: Rabbitmen are not strong enough to wear armour. Even an unadorned helmet weighs enough to make them unable to stand tall. These "knights" are not nobles like the civilised equivalent, but rather, simply stronger fighters of the warren. For rabbitmen that dedicate too much to the pursuit of war, there is no return to a joyful life ever again.

Name: Rabbit Rooligan
Description: A rabbitman slinger. Decent skirmisher in its own right and can dig the ground to lay trap against approaching enemies.
Lore: Stones exist in abundance, even in forests. So it is no surprise that rabbitmen chose the sling as their ranged weapon of choice. No need to carry too much ammunition, and the sling is light to wield. These Rabbit Rooligans also bring a shovel to dig for more slingshots and make a rabbit hole for setting up a trap against invaders. These shovels later on become the symbol of nation-building for both the rabbitmen nations and outsiders.

Name: Rabbit Rhell Rompanion
Description: A rabbitman snail cavalry. Slow but tough.
Lore: Rabbitman on a snail, a combination of two ends of attributes that creates paradoxical strength. With the swiftness of rabbitmen and toughness of snails,  Rabbit Rhell Rompanions excel at neither of the two. Conceivably, this amalgamation will divulge its unrecognised advantages in the unforeseen future that puts knights and their horses to shame.

Name: Rabbit Raider
Description: A footsoldier rabbit spearman. Weak but strong in number. Can inflict slow and charge enemies.
Lore: The life of Rabbitmen usually involves no fighting. Like their bunny cousins, they tend to flee from predators and can only bite with their meagre teeth at best. The first weapon they picked up was the easiest to learn, the spear. There is joy to be found when the prey can fight back in numbers, reversing the natural order of things. Many believe that such an occurrence is one of the punishments the gods invoke on the civilised chosen for their endless misdeeds against nature.

Name: Rabbit Rower
Description: A small stone tower with a lone stone thrower rabbitman. Solid but not by much. When earth fail, stone will prevail.
Lore: Rabbitmen are no strangers to civilised innovations. As their countries grow, so too does the requirement to protect their territory. And surely, as any sedentary society with self-preservation, towers are erected all over to guard the homeland. Thus, the verts and the houses are no different from the other.

Name: Rabbit Roulder
Description: A flimsy cheap trebuchet good for small siege. Very slow but deals good damage to buildings.
Lore: Rabbitmen are not so well-versed in the art of craftsmanship. These trebuchets are a miracle in themselves, as they do not break down after a single use. With the help of Iri the Traveller, the Alliance manages to mass-produce these little trebuchets cheaply against the formidable stronghold of civilisations. Quantity over quality, and so begins the Vertkin conquest of the world.

Name: Toxic Mollusk
Description: A bitter old snail that retains only disdain for other creatures after living for so long. Will throw his toxic beard at anyone he deems annoying.
Lore: Snails are actually wise creatures, as is quite apparent in their sagely old man face. Their favourite motto is "To know everything one must first know nothing". Boiling their beards and dropping the infused essence into the eyes of elderly people can cure senility.

Name: Snail Defender
Description: A young snail armed with a sword and shield. An eternal enemy to all knights. Deals poison damage.
Lore: Tortoise worms that always carry around two shields at all times, one to live in and one to protect itself. When rain comes, snails will raise their heads toward heaven and contemplate. Since they like to eat delicious plant leaves of all sorts, every gardener loathes them.

Name: Earth Wall
Description: An earth wall. Huge, durable, and tall enough that it can firmly block almost anything.
Lore: Those who can command the land are given a first glimpse of prosperity. To lay bare the secret of the buried treasures of the Origin Mother is the ambition of all earthen wizards.

Name: Hound
Description: A hound. Very fast and fierce. Will bite only enemies.
Lore: Hounds are honest and loyal creatures. No matter the commands, they will obey without fail. They will never stop and return until their given mission is completed. When hounds are given a bone, they will bury it instead.

Name: Scorpion
Description: An automated scorpion anti-personnel weapon. Capable of dealing decent damage, but is rather fragile.
Lore: Invention of a genius, these Anti-personnel Scorpions require no manual control. These apparatuses will continue shooting at nearby foes until their magazine is empty. Iri the Traveller keeps her secret so well that not even the dwarf master tinkerers have been managing to replicate the function. Some suspect that the technology of these scorpions is the same as that of the Doll Family.

Description: A skeleton wall. Not exactly the most durable of walls, but is good enough for disrupting weak enemies' attacks.

Name: Bear
Description: A large bear. Tough and strong. Its roll can crush and destroy even a knight.

Name: Boar
Description: A speedy boar. The tusks can pierce heavy armour with ease. Beware of its charge.
